main.name: Ting Chung
main.description: I am currently a Flatiron school student studying full-stack web development. I am formerly a aircraft systems engineer.
main.bio: I am a Flatiron student studying full-stack web development. I was previously an aircraft systems engineer and now looking for a full-time position as a software developer.
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

resume.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

education.description: Developed software development skills using Ruby, Ruby on Rails, Javascript, and React. Used languages and web frameworks to develop projects.
Developed electronic design skills and learned hardware principles. Skilled in C++ for micro-controller unit designs. Matlab for digital signal processing.

work.title: Technical Specialist I
work.description: Implemented electrical design solutions for brakes, landing gear, hydraulics, and doors systems. Investigated and resolved flight test and lab issues through troubleshooting and integration testing. Developed validation and verification for brake control system requirements.

work.title: Service Center Coordinator
work.description: Co-manager of Chinese aircraft maintenance visits. Created and maintained work scope and project accomplishments. Chartered and monitored customer invoices.

work.title: Electrical Engineer
work.description: Developed electronic hardware for line replaceable units including analog and digital circuitry, A429 ICs, LED drivers, analog-to-digital and digital-to-analog converters, and amplifiers. Designed circuit simulation models for analysis. Performed electromagnetic interference susceptibility testing.

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
